DOC.brief_summary: Purpose : The purpose study demonstrate potential efficacy venlafaxine administration reduce acute chronic musculoskeletal pain individual present ED evaluation motor vehicle collision . Participants : Participants consist 60 patient age 18-50 present ED within 12 hour post-motor vehicle collision . Patients report neck pain score > 6 screened eligibility . Procedures ( method ) : Using placebo-controlled , randomize , double-blind trial design , 60 high risk patient randomize venlafaxine vs. placebo ED . The ability venlafaxine decrease acute persistent musculoskeletal neck pain assess serial short-term telephone follow-ups well in-depth follow-up 6 week , 4 month , 6 month post-MVC .
DOC.brief_title: Healing With Venlafaxine After Injury ( HELP )
DOC.detailed_description: Results animal human study suggest treatment serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor ( SNRIs ) venlafaxine may reduce post-MVC pain . In addition , venlafaxine show beneficial reduce posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) symptom , patient PTSD symptom may contribute reinforce pain persistence trauma . This phase IIB pilot trial screen patient present ED MVC presence severe axial pain ( > 4 0-10 numeric rating scale ) . Sixty `` high risk '' patient randomize venlafaxine vs. placebo , ability venlafaxine decrease acute persistent musculoskeletal axial pain assess . Results use design large-scale RCT assess efficacy venlafaxine intervention decrease acute persistent musculoskeletal pain high-risk patient present ED minor MVC .
DOC.criteria: Between age 18 59 Presents ED within 24 hour MVC ED axial pain score great equal 4 ( 010 NRS ) Clinically sober Willing provide blood sample Has telephone Has regular access Internet email address Able speak read English Permanent US citizen green card Blood pressure reading ( ) ED , consider context patient past current history , investigator 's judgment exceed acceptable level Axial pain score great 0 past month ( 010 NRS ) Clinically unstable Fracture ( fracture phalanx ) Substantial soft tissue injury Hepatic failure ( acute chronic ) Renal failure ( acute chronic ) Coronary artery disease , include previous MI , Angina , PCTA , etc . History glaucoma Previous congestive heart failure History seizure disorder History mania psychotic disorder History suicidal ideation Prisoner History behavior indicate , investigator 's judgment , participant would likely noncompliant study Any condition , investigator 's judgment , would indicate patient unsuitable study ( e.g . might interfere study , confound interpretation , endanger patient ) Currently take monoamine oxidase inhibitor Currently take medication substantial interaction venlafaxine , could confound interpretation study result Breastfeeding If female , either postmenopausal ( menses within past year ) , , childbearing potential , positive pregnancy test prior randomization use medically acceptable form contraception Exceeds acceptable chronic daily opioid use prior MVC Previously venlafaxine Previous allergic reaction venlafaxine Antidepressant use within 2 week study start ( 4 week Prozac )
